properties.title: Aluminium
properties.author: Carl Wilhelm Siemens
properties.description: Aluminium is one of the most abundant metals. But, it was only in the 1880s that production processes were invented which enabled aluminium to be produced cheaply. Carl Wilhelm Siemens (US) developed a smelter to produce Aluminium from Bauxite ore in 1886. Aluminium is used extensively in building and aeroplane manufacture.

properties.title: Aeroplane/aviation
properties.author: Orville Wright
properties.description: The first powered, heavier than air flight was undertaken by Orville Wright on December 17, 1903. The first aeroplane was made of wood. By 1909, they made a demonstration of flight around the Hudson River in New York. Aeroplane technology rapidly improved, and they were used for military means in the First World War.

properties.title: Antiseptics
properties.author: Dr Ignaz Semmelweis
properties.description: Dr Semmelweis a Hungarian physician was the first prominent doctor to make a strong link between the use of antiseptics and improving survival rates of women giving birth. His work was taken up by others, such as Joseph Lister who became a pioneer of antiseptic surgery.

properties.title: Archimedes Screw
properties.author: Archimedes of Syracuse
properties.description: Invented by Archimedes of Syracuse, this innovative design enabled water to be pulled uphill against gravity.

properties.title: Atomic Bomb
properties.author: Robert Oppenheimer
properties.description: Between this period a team of scientists developed the first atomic bomb as part of the Manhattan project. Chief of the project was Robert Oppenheimer.

properties.title: Ballpoint pen
properties.author: László Bíró
properties.description: László Bíró, a Hungarian newspaper editor, developed a more suitable ink and ball socket mechanism to prevent ink drying. He filed his first patent in 1938 for a ballpoint pen in Argentina. After the war, varieties of the ballpoint pen became commercially successful.

properties.title: Clocks
properties.author: Christian Huygens
properties.description: Christian Huygens developed the pendulum which made primitive clocks more accurate.

properties.title: Guns
properties.author: Hiram Maxim
properties.description: The first gun prototypes using gunpowder to launch missiles were developed in the Tenth-Century by the Chinese. The first rifle ‘Puckle Gun’ was developed in 1718 and the first revolver ‘The Colt’ in 1836. The first machine gun in 1884 by Sir Hiram Maxim.

properties.title: Paper
properties.author: Tsai Lun – Lun
properties.description: Tsai Lun – Lun was an official in the Chinese civil service. He reported and developed its use in recording the business of the Chinese state.

properties.title: Printing Press
properties.author: Johannes Gutenberg
properties.description: The first printing press was designed by Johannes Gutenberg in Germany. The printing press played a key role in the Protestant Reformation – as pamphlets and books were mass produced for the first time, helping to spread new ideas more quickly.
